summary.para: The VMRRenderPrefs enumeration type is used with the and methods to get and set basic rendering preferences.

remarks.para: By default the VMR-7 tries to allocate DirectDraw texture surfaces from Video Memory and falls back to AGP memory if there is no Video Memory remaining to fulfill the allocation. In order for the VMR-7 to use AGP memory, the graphics card must have some basic support for blitting from AGP memory to Video Memory.

summary.para: Indicates that the Video Mixing Renderer Filter 7 (VMR-7) should use only offscreen surfaces for rendering.
Indicates that the VMR-7 should fail if no overlay surfaces are available.
Indicates that the VMR-7 should use overlays if they are available. Should not be used by new applications.
Indicates that the VMR-7 should use offscreen surfaces if no overlays are available. Should not be used by new applications.
Indicates that the application is responsible for painting the color keys.
Indicates that the VMR-7 should attempt to use AGP memory when allocating texture surfaces.
Bitwise OR of all of the above flags.
